metadata.title: CVE-2024-43912 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:wifi: nl80211: disallow setting special AP channel widthsSetting the AP channel width is meant for use with the normal20/40/... MHz channel width progression, and switching aroundin S1G or narrow channels isn't supported. Disallow that.

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty is affected and may need fixing.
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty is affected and may need fixing.
linux-aws package in trusty is affected and may need fixing.
linux-azure package in trusty is affected and may need fixing.
